extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1-2 leftover roasted Brussels sprouts (or a handful of spinach or salad greens would be great)
metaInformation: (or a handful of spinach or salad greens would be great)

extendedIngredients.name: dried cranberries
extendedIngredients.originalString: 10g of Dried Cranberries (or a smear of cranberry sauce) chopped

recipes.title: Leftover Turkey Quesadilla with Cranberries and Gouda

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are great choices for Fingerfood. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium high heat and spray with non-stick cooking spray.Lay the tortilla in the skillet sprinkling half of it with 1/2 of the cheese. Add the turkey, brussels sprouts and dried cranberries, top with the remaining cheese then fold over. Weigh it down with something like a kettle full of water and cook for about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side for an additional minute until the cheese is melted and the ingredients are warmed through.I served it with a quick side salad for a complete lunch.The gears are already turning on what to do with the turkey tomorrow. :)

steps.step: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium high heat and spray with non-stick cooking spray.Lay the tortilla in the skillet sprinkling half of it with 1/2 of the cheese.

Add the turkey, brussels sprouts and dried cranberries, top with the remaining cheese then fold over. Weigh it down with something like a kettle full of water and cook for about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side for an additional minute until the cheese is melted and the ingredients are warmed through.I served it with a quick side salad for a complete lunch.The gears are already turning on what to do with the turkey tomorrow. :)
